content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Define the code fence pattern for Julia code blocks
    julia_fence_start = r"^```julia\s*$"
    julia_fence_end = r"^```\s*$"
    
    # Initialize an empty array to hold code blocks
    code_blocks = []
    capture = false
    block = []
    
    # Iterate over the lines of the markdown document
    for line in split(md, "\n")
        # Check if the line is a start of a Julia code block
        if occursin(julia_fence_start, line)
            capture = true
            continue
        end
        # Check if the line is an end of a Julia code block
        if capture && occursin(julia_fence_end, line)
            capture = false
            push!(code_blocks, join(block, "\n"))
            block = []
            continue
        end
        # If inside a Julia code block, capture the line
        if capture
            push!(block, line)
        end
    end
    
    # Join all the captured blocks with newlines between them
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end
```
